item.title: Gpc and Keybase
item.description: author : iambowen keybase GPG(GnuPG)æ˜¯ä¸€ç§ä½¿ç”¨æ··åˆåŠ å¯†æŠ€æœ¯(å¯¹ç§°/éå¯¹ç§°ï¼Œå¯¹ç§°åŠ å¯†æå‡åŠ å¯†é€Ÿåº¦ï¼Œå…¬é’¥åŠ å¯†ç”¨æ¥ä¿è¯keyäº¤æ¢æ—¶çš„å®‰å…¨æ€§)çš„åº”ç”¨ã€‚å®ƒçš„ä¸»è¦ä½œç”¨åœ¨äº: èº«ä»½éªŒè¯ã€‚å¯¹è‡ªå·±çš„å·¥ä½œç­¾åï¼Œæ¯”å¦‚gitæäº¤ï¼Œé‚®ä»¶ç­‰ã€‚ åŠ å¯†ã€‚å¯¹äº¤æµçš„è¿‡ç¨‹è¿›è¡ŒåŠ å¯†ä¿æŠ¤ï¼Œé˜²æ­¢è¢«åˆ«äººçªƒå–ã€‚ å¦‚æœæ˜¯ç”¨gpgå·¥å…·æ¥ç”Ÿæˆå’Œå‘å¸ƒkeyçš„è¯ï¼Œæµç¨‹æ˜¯è¿™æ ·çš„: ç”Ÿæˆkey ~> gpg --gen-key gpg (GnuPG) 1.4.19; Copyright (C) 2015 Free Software Foundation, Inc. This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it. There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law. Please select what kind of key you want: (1) RSA and RSA (default) (2) DSA and Elgamal (3) DSA (sign only) (4) RSA (sign only) Your selection?

item.title: Learning Xpath
item.description: XPath Tutorial Selecting Nodes XPath uses path expressions to select nodes in an XML document. The node is selected by following a path or steps. The most useful path expressions are listed below: Expression Description ä¸­æ–‡ nodename Selects all nodes with the name “nodename” é€‰æ‹©æ‰€æœ‰åå­—ä¸º”nodename”çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹ / Selects from the root node ä»æ ¹èŠ‚ç‚¹æœç´¢ // Selects nodes in the document from the current node that match the selection no matter where they are ä»å…¨æ–‡æ‰€æœ .

item.title: Creating a New Theme
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content. I’ll explain how Hugo uses templates and how you can organize your templates to create a theme. I won’t cover using CSS to style your theme. We’ll start with creating a new site with a very basic template.

item.title: Markdown Example
item.description: For example to add an HTML table to a Markdown article: This is a regular paragraph. Foo This is another regular paragraph. Note that Markdown formatting syntax is not processed within block-level HTML tags. E.g., you canâ€™t use Markdown-style emphasis inside an HTML block. Span-level HTML tags â€” e.g. , , or â€” can be used anywhere in a Markdown paragraph, list item, or header.

item.title: Elasticsearch Query Dsl
item.description: Index: product_test 1. Query all GET /_search { “query”: { “match_all”: {} } } 2. Query by index GET product_test/_search { “query”: { “match_all”: {} } } 3. Like. â€˜5%’ GET product_test/_search { “query”: { “bool”: { “filter”: [ { “prefix”: { “name”: “name_5” }} ] } } } 4. Like. â€˜5%1’ GET product_test/_search { “query”: { “bool”: { “filter”: [ { “wildcard”: { “name”: “name_5*1” }} ] } } } 5.

item.title: Hugo Learning Notes
item.description: Install Install hugo brew install hugo hugo version Create a New Site hugo new site sillyhat-hugo Add a Theme cd sillyhat-hugo cd themes git clone https://github.com/giraffeacademy/ga-hugo-theme.git echo 'theme = "ga-hugo-theme"' >> config.toml Add Some Content hugo new A.md Start the Hugo server hugo server -D Navigate to your new site at http://localhost:1313/ Properties

item.title: Run Docker Image From Gitlab
item.description: docker run sudo docker run --detach \ --hostname gitlab.xushikuan.com \ --publish 443:443 --publish 80:80 --publish 2222:22 \ --name gitlab \ --restart always \ --env GITLAB_OMNIBUS_CONFIG="gitlab_rails['backup_keep_time'] = 60;gitlab_rails['manage_backup_path'] = true;gitlab_rails['backup_path'] = '/var/opt/gitlab/backups'" \ --volume /home/ubuntu/gitlab/config:/etc/gitlab \ --volume /home/ubuntu/gitlab/logs:/var/log/gitlab \ --volume /home/ubuntu/gitlab/data:/var/opt/gitlab \ gitlab/gitlab-ce:11.3.0-rc6.ce.0

item.title: Git Operator Record
item.description: æš‚æ—¶å‚¨è— git stash ä»å‚¨è—ä¸­å–å‡ºï¼ˆé»˜è®¤å–å‡ºæœ€åä¸€ä¸ªï¼‰ git stash apply æ¸…ç©º git stash clear æŸ¥çœ‹stashåˆ—è¡¨ git stash list æŒ‡å®šè¦å–å‡ºçš„å‚¨è—ä»£ç git stash apply stash@{1} å¼ºåˆ¶è¿˜åŸc git reset –hard

item.title: Docker Clear Containers And Images
item.description: docker image prune -a æ·±åº¦æ¸…ç† docker system prune -a Delete all containers docker rm $(docker ps -a -q) Delete all images docker rmi $(docker images -q) docker rmi -f $(docker images -q) Other command docker container ls -a docker rm -v $(docker images --filter "dangling=true" -q --no-trunc) docker rmi $(docker images --filter "dangling=true" -q --no-trunc)

item.title: Docker Command
